* [[Tawnia Baker]]
* [[Frankie "Dishpan Man" Santana]]
* [[General Hunt Stockwell]]

h4. Japanese history

It was also televised in Japan from 1985 with the title 特攻野郎Aチーム ("[i]Tokkou Yarou A-Team[/i]" lit. "Special Attack Bastards A-Team"). In the Japanese dubbed version, Bosco Albert Baracus's nickname was changed from "B.A." to "Kong", H. M. Murdock's from "Howling Mad" to "Crazy Monkey" and Amy Amanda Allen's from "Triple A" to "Angel".

The popularity of this series in Japan was due not only to its content and the good quality of the dubbing, but also to the self-introductory voiceovers by each member of the team, which were added to the opening sequence. These opening lines are so famous that if you were to do a search with those Japanese keywords, you would be able to find an endless number of parodies on the web.

[quote]We were members of a special attack force, well known in Vietnam. We were arrested by the authorities under false accusations but we managed to escape from prison and went underground. However, we were not the type of people to simply fester underground. We are a team of reckless men who are capable of anything, as long as we are well paid and the reason is justifiable; we make the impossible possible; we destroy great evils; we are the Tokkou Yarou A-Team!

"I am the leader, Colonel John Smith. Also known as Hannibal. I am a master of disguise and an expert in ambush tactics. If it wasn't because I am such a gifted strategist, I wouldn't be the leader of such a strong team of veterans."

"I am Templeton Peck. Also known as Faceman. Women always surrender to my amazing looks. I can bluff my way through life and I can get you anything, from bras to missiles, you'll see!"

"I am Amy Amanda Allen, also known as Angel. I am the only woman in the team. Intelligence gathering is my speciality, with my pretty face and bright brain!"

"Heeey, sorry to keep you waiting! I am Murdock. Also known as Crazy Monkey. My skills as a pilot are second to none! 
An eccentric? A weird character? So what?"

"I am B. A. Baracus, also known as Kong. I am a genius mechanic. I would even punch the President! But, just don't make me get on a plane!"

We challenge this unreasonable world. We are reliable and ubiquitous, the [i]Tokkou Yarou[/i] A-Team! If you need any help, just call us any time. 
[/quote]

h4. See also

* "Wikipedia article":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_A-Team
* Youtube: "The A-Team - Opening (Japanese Ver.)":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ctovammXPh4&t=1m2s

title: sega
body:
[b]Sega Corporation[/b] (株式会社セガ [i]Kabushiki gaisha Sega[/i]), pronounced /ˈseɪɡə/ (US/Canada/UK/New Zealand/Australia) and usually styled as [b]SEGA[/b], is a Japanese multinational [[video game]] developer, publisher and hardware development company headquartered in Tokyo, Japan, with various offices around the world. 

The company started as the merger of two different coin-operated game machine companies made by Americans: [i]Service Games[/i] created in Hawaii in 1940 and [i]Rosen Enterprises[/i] founded in Japan in 1954. The name SEGA comes from [b]SE[/b]rvice [b]GA[/b]mes.

Originally a maker of video [[game console]]s, it later shifted into just creating and publishing video games for other game consoles. However, in 2019 the company published a miniature version of their popular Sega Mega Drive console with several built-in games included.

SEGA is the creator of the popular [[Sonic (series)|]] franchise.

Since 2013, it is the parent company of fellow publisher [[Atlus]].

SEGA was also a major [[arcade]] operator and owned several iconic arcades in Japan.  Due to declining income, especially caused by the COVID-19 Pandemic, in 2022 they completely sold off their arcade operations division to GENDA Inc.  All remaining SEGA branded arcades to be rebranded with the "GiGO" logo (short for "Get into the Gaming Oasis").

title: princess_connect!
body:
Princess Connect! is a web browser game created by [[Cygames]] which closed in late 2015. In August 2016, [b]Princess Connect! Re:Dive[/b] was announced as a remake of the original game and advertised as an Anime RPG.

In February 2018, the game was officially released for Android and iOS. The remake is notable for using an anime-style format to tell its story complete with an "opening song":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Hq8uuBB7SoM], "cutscenes":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=447], "ending credits":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XXC4TSTuxU], and even a next "episode preview":[https://youtu.be/xCX1Qx40sUM?t=739]. Wit Studio is credited for the anime portions of the game. A global version was released on January 19, 2021, and later "ended":[https://www.crunchyroll.com/news/latest/2023/3/30/an-important-update-regarding-princess-connect-re-dive] on April 30, 2023.

The gameplay in the remake is heavily reliant on team composition to progress through the more difficult portions of the game and encourages raising multiple characters to complete certain challenges. Despite differing initial rarities, all characters can be raised to the maximum rarity which unlocks their full stories and maximum potential.

In the original story, the game was set in "Legend of Astrum", an MMO where the player would meet various girls and recruit them. Because of the MMO setting, each girl had a fantasy version and a real-life version. The story in the remake plays out as a sequel, starting the narrative with a "Bad End" to the original series in which the characters remain in the MMO, unaware of there ever being a separate real world.

h4. Main Characters

h6. Player

* !asset #20023209: [[Yuuki_(princess_connect!)|]]

title: hololive_error
body:
Hololive Error (stylized as hololive ERROR) is a [[horror (theme)|]] multimedia project by Cover Corporation featuring [[Virtual YouTuber]]s from [[Hololive]], with six short world-building 3D VR episodes, a first-person VR game, and an animated manga series.

The game features original characters portrayed by Hololive members, and the short 3D VR animations have been released on the official Hololive YouTube channel to promote it. Several of the featured VTubers played a demo during a "livestream":[https://youtu.be/WQQAwozBg94?t=2565] about the project.

A demo for the game was released for free on January 7, 2022, and can be downloaded from the official hololive ERROR website. It is currently only available in Japanese, with no planned English release yet. The manga series started on February 19, 2022, and can be "found here":[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL1NeGg1woXqmjylfq2x5E8dA2TUvQcK26].

The story follows a transfer student at Aogami High School, a school at the center of an collection of urban legends and bizarre incidents.

h4. Characters

h5. Protagonist

* Misora Shino (played by [[Tokino Sora]])

h5. Modern Arc

* Shirayuki Inari (played by [[Shirakami Fubuki]])

h5. Classic Arc

h5. Train Arc

h5. Revelations Arc

title: pomu_rainpuff_(3rd_costume)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Pomu Rainpuff]], as seen in post #6135782. Contrary to popular belief, and "#PomuGear":[https://twitter.com/PomuRainpuff/status/1631878111766749192] being the costume reveal hashtag, and the [[metal gear solid 2: sons of liberty|Metal Gear Solid 2]]-inspired aesthetic of the "costume reveal stream":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hCeTppLnHsQ, the "costume itself is not based on the Metal Gear franchise":[https://youtu.be/RrYAvRGAfrw?t=11676].

Tactically-themed, it consists of a black [[crop top]] and [[black shorts]] with a [[thigh pouch]] [[thigh strap|strapped to her left thigh]], [[black footwear|black]] [[knee boots]], [[black jacket]], [[black belt]], and a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]]. She also has a [[knife]] as her [[weapon]], while her hair is colored [[grey hair|grey]] and tied [[side ponytail|as a ponytail to her left]].

h4. External links

* "Associated lore video (prequel to the costume reveal stream)":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HU7Ca_bQ-TQ]

title: mach_rider_(character)
body:
[quote]YOU ARE "MACH RIDER"![/quote]

The titular main protagonist of [[Mach Rider]]. Riding a [[motorcycle]] mounted with [[machine gun]]s, he is Earth's last hope in fighting back against the invading alien forces as he searches for a new frontier. 

His trophy and music theme in [i][[Super Smash Bros.]] Melee[/i] gained him greater recognition. 

It is debated that Mach Rider is possibly a woman. This is due to [i]Vs. Mach Rider[/i], the arcade version, slowly reveals a skimpy woman holding a knife next to Mach Rider's bike the more levels you complete, with beating the final level revealing her fully[tn]"[1]":[https://www.vgmuseum.com/end/arcade/b/vsmachrider.htm][/tn][tn]"[2]":[https://youtu.be/HNYmaLtm8_w?t=985][/tn]. This is further fueled by the Japanese gaming magazine "High Score" September 1986 issue, which had a pin-up poster of a female Mach Rider[tn]"[3]":[https://twitter.com/Shino4know/status/1365149590085894144][/tn][tn]"[4]":[https://pbs.twimg.com/media/EvFcrFYUYAIdSx3.jpg:orig][/tn], created by Yasuo Torai (虎井安夫) and Yasuhiro Kagami (鏡泰裕). No context was ever given who these women are, leading to speculation.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #24255989: Cover Art
* !asset #24255993: Vs. Mach Rider
* !asset #24255995: Super Smash Bros. Melee

title: ina's_back_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] related to [[Ninomae Ina'nis]]' [[bare back]] (and occasionally, her [[ass]]). It originates from a certain moment during a [[holoMyth]] off-collab "3D stream":[https://youtu.be/3wsiJVzv9vg?t=1793], in which Ina, using her 3D avatar, briefly exposed the rarely-seen back side of her body directly at the camera. On top of that, the quick spin caused her [[waist cape]] to glitch and  ending up in a position that have very strong impression of [[wide hips]]/[[huge ass]], leading to a large surge of fanart  [[back focus|focusing on her back]] (and [[ass focus|her ass]] too). Additionally, "Ina's back" doubles nicely as a pun, as the event coincided with Ina returning from an extended break.

Be mindful when using this tag. Don't add it to every single [[back focus]]/[[ass focus]] or [[from behind]] posts featuring Ina. The image has to be a clear reference to the incident.

h4. External links

* "Imgur: Original screenshot":https://i.imgur.com/2TkRU67.png
* "Youtube:【OFF COLLAB】ARMWRESTLING BATTLE w/ HoloMyth!":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3wsiJVzv9vg]

title: orfevre_(old_design)_(umamusume)
body:
[tn]French: "Goldsmith"[/tn]

An [[Umamusume]] character who was the Triple Crown winner of 2011. Who is notorious for "playing" with his IRL jockey.

Originally made a brief appearance in the 2016 Umamusume Pretty Derby promotional video. 

Most salient trait of this 2016 appearance is her [[mouth mask|face mask]]. Appears to have a split personality that surfaces when her mask is removed. 

* !asset #23246905

Generally drawn together with [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]], as the latter lacks a "canonical pair" to be drawn with. Sometimes these two are further drawn together with [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] and [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]] to form the "Stay Gold Family". She is also often drawn along with [[Curren Chan (umamusume)|]] or [[Sweep Tosho (umamusume)|]] as they had the [[ikezoe ken'ichi|same jockey]].

Name-dropped by Gold Ship in the 3rd episode of Season 3 of the Umamusume anime.

She was later added to the game in 2024 with a "newer design":[/posts/7252970] that is [[orfevre (umamusume)|distinct from her 2016 appearance]].

h5. Associated characters

*  [[Nakayama Festa (umamusume)|]]
** Real-life counterpart is the [spoiler]half-brother of Orfevre[/spoiler].
* [[Gold Ship (umamusume)|]]
** Real-life counterpart is the [spoiler]half-brother of Orfevre[/spoiler].
*  [[Kin'iro Ryotei (umamusume)|]] 
** Real-life counterpart is the [spoiler]father of Orfevre, Nakayama Festa and Gold Ship[/spoiler].

h4. External links

* "Umamusume Pretty Derby PV (2016): 1:23":[https://youtu.be/HYrVKLBhitE?t=83]

title: ishowspeed_trying_not_to_laugh_(meme)
body:
This meme references a clipped moment from one of IShowSpeed's [[Fortnite]] streams on 31 December 2021, where he plays 1v1 wager battles against his fans. 

One of Speed's opponents, a seemingly financially-challenged teenager, starts to hysterically breakdown from his continuous defeats, crying about his struggling economic situation and how his mother is 'kinda homeless', which humors Speed from his delivery. However, he is called out by another fan for almost laughing, which forces Speed to suppress it, making a smiling, tight-lipped expression.

h4. External links

* Source: "EARLY STREAM!":https://youtu.be/ZIPCptw_Otg?t=7677 @ 2:07:57

title: nakamori_nanaka
body:
Nakamori Nanaka (仲森 奈々華) is a fledgling Taimanin, that has just graduated from Gosha Academy.
She was introduced in [[Taimanin RPGX]]. Designed by [[Saijou Satoru]].
She has a cheerful and positive personality, but she has a tendency to rush into battle without thinking twice when faced with an enemy.
Nanaka is a hard worker and has a cheerful attitude towards everyone, and is well liked by her friends, who follow her even in dangerous situations.

title: miraculous_ladybug
body:
A [[magical girl]]/superhero joint effort by France's Zagtoon and Method Animation studios with [[Toei Animation]]. It received a promotional video in 2012, followed by a trailer in 2013; the series proper premiered in Korea in September 2015, in France in October 2015, and in the US in December 2015.

[[Marinette Dupain-Cheng]] is an ordinary high-schooler living in Paris. After inheriting a pair of magic ladybug earrings, she gains the power to become the superheroine [[Ladybug (character)|]]. Her superpower is the Power of Luck - if she uses it for altruistic purposes only. Joining in her adventures is a black-clothed [[cat boy]] named [[Chat Noir]] (whose secret identity [[Adrien Agreste]] happens to be the boy Marinette has a crush on), a [[mime]] villain, another villain who fights with an army of [[pigeon]]s, and a mysterious elderly man with a [[butterfly]] motif.

h4. See also

* [[Felix (miraculous ladybug)|]] - Adrien's beta design

h4. External links

* "Official site":http://zagtoon.com/?p=shows&s=ladybug
* "Ladybug PV":http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FlwV3scCgAM

title: censored_pomu
body:
An evil [[eldritch abomination]] version of [[Pomu Rainpuff]] in a horrifying, distorted blood-red form. She first appeared in Pomu's "short  horror-themed pseudo-ARG collaboration":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7FOB5jnb3hw] with [[Elira Pendora]] as a red-colored Pomu with a demonic voice. With the addition of [[Ethyria]], her appearance has become much more hauntingly ghost-like, and she is almost always seen donning a copy of [[Reimu Endou]]'s [[hat]].

The name [b]Censored Pomu[/b] comes from her membership emotes, where the emoji depicting this Pomu is simply named ":pomuCensored:". Also known as [b]Cursed Pomu[/b].

h4. External links

* "Origin of Post-Ethyria Censored Pomu":[https://twitter.com/PomuRainpuff/status/1446497971340824578]
* "First appearance of Post-Ethyria Censored Pomu on stream":[https://youtu.be/YjXEcLlNSTg?t=2678]

title: ign_x_va-11_hall-a_contest
body:
The [i]IGN x VA-11 HALL-A[/i] fanart contest ran from October 21 to November 3, 2017.

The contest was held in anticipation of the Japanese PS Vita release of [i][[VA-11 HALL-A]][/i].
Contestants entered by tweeting their illustration with the hashtag "#IGNxVA11HallAイラコン":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/IGNxVA11HallA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3].

h4. Prizes [2]

[quote]
* 最優秀賞（1名）：PS Vitaパッケージ版「VA-11 Hall-A」初回特典付（サウンドトラックCDとコースター）
* 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
* 参加賞（抽選で20名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」ノベルティ用ポストカード
[/quote]

h4. Results [2]

Below are the contest results. 
The creators of [i]VA-11 HALL-A[/i], [[kiririn51|Christopher Ortiz]] (design and illustration) and Fernando Damas (writing and programming), wrote comments about each of the winning entries. In some cases, these comments have been included in the Commentary of the below linked posts.

* Grand prize
** [[bamboo (merenge doll)|merenge doll]] - post #3034507

* Fighting Spirit Prize (Runner up)
** 

* Fighting Spirit Prize (9 awarded) 敢闘賞9名 - 敢闘賞（10名）：「VA-11 Hall-A」Steam キー（発売に合わせて日本語がアップデート予定。既にお買上げの方は布教用に使おう！）
** [[Tsujita Daisuke]]  - post #3034483, post #3034489

h4. External links

* "Contest announcement and rules":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/18564/news/va-11-hall-a]
* [2] "Contest results":[http://jp.ign.com/vallhalla/19287/news/va-11-hall-a]
* "Twitter #IGNxVA11HallAイラコン":[https://twitter.com/hashtag/IGNxVA11HallA%E3%82%A4%E3%83%A9%E3%82%B3%E3%83%B3]

title: shizukou
body:
Former British [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]] [[virtual youtuber]]. "Graduated on February 29, 2024.":[https://twitter.com/Shizukougames/status/1753510911581856075]

h4. Appearance

Shizukou's original design and it's alternate costumes were illustrated by [[Mint (psmin30)]]. Her base design (post #5905014) is a short, [[flat chest]]ed girl with [[blue eyes]] and [[short hair|]] [[purple hair]] styled with [[double bun]]s. In her original outfit she wears a [[white dress]] with a [[black bow]] under a [[black jacket]], and [[black footwear|black]] [[shoes]], as well as a [[controller hair ornament]].

Her second outfit (post #5905044) is a summer-themed outfit consisting of a [[blue kimono]] with an [[obi]]. In this appearance she still has short hair, but it is worn in a [[one side up]] style, with a [[black bow|black]] [[hair bow|bow]], [[red flower]] and [[white flower|white]] [[hair flower]]s, and a [[hairclip]].

Her third outfit (post #4598450) is a regal outfit consisting of a [[white dress]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[yellow belt]], a [[fur-trimmed cape|fur-trimmed]] [[black cape]], [[heart earrings]], and a [[mini crown]]. In this appearance she has [[long hair]] with a [[white bow|white]] [[hair bow|bow]] worn in a [[one side up]] style.

In 2022, she rebranded with a fully redesigned model illustrated by [[k pring]]. This design (post #5888288) is themed after a Portuguese man-o-war and is a [[large breasts|large breasted]] woman with [[purple eyes]], [[tentacles]], and [[very long hair|very long]] [[grey hair]] ([[colored inner hair|colored]] [[blue hair|blue]] on the underside) worn either [[straight hair|straight]] or in [[two side up]]. Her outfit is a set of [[revealing clothes]] comprised of a [[short dress|short]] [[white dress]] with a [[navel cutout]], [[puffy long sleeves|puffy]] [[detached sleeves]], and [[white footwear|white]] [[thigh boots]]. The rebrand was short-lived and she ultimately returned to her original design in 2023.

h4. External links

* "YouTube":[https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCYKX4HL54erXdCyMj7TpFyg]
* "Twitch":[https://www.twitch.tv/shizukou]
* "BiliBili":[https://space.bilibili.com/1042854135]
* "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/Shizukougames]

body:
A mascot/caricature of [[Yukihana Lamy]] drawn by [[Momosuzu Nene]] at the request of [[Omaru Polka]].

A white ball with an [[^o^]] expression, Lamy's signature [[heart ahoge]] and [[bowtie]] and the text "[i]やめなー[/i] "([i]yamenaa[/i], meaning "stop it" or "cut it out"), a catchphrase associated with Lamy and often thrown at Nene's for her rather immature (and quite inappropriate for an idol) sense of humor. It's sometimes drawn with Polka's arms.

title: js_kaga_(ddh-184)
body:
The second ship of the Izumo-class "helicopter carrier destroyers" (DDH-184) that was launched on 27 August 2015 and later "converted" into an [[aircraft carrier]]. Also the first ship to bear the Kaga name since the Tosa-class battleship turned aircraft carrier from World War II.

Consequently, she has appeared in art featuring her [i][[Kantai Collection]][/i] [[Kaga (Kancolle)|version]], including in "official art":[https://twitter.com/ko131415/status/1064360710514237441] shown on an on-deck poster. 

h4. See also

* [[JS Izumo (DDH-183)]]
* [[JS Kaga (Kancolle)]]

title: sakuro_kaiya
body:
A Vietnamese [[indie virtual youtuber|indie VTuber]]. Her character model was designed by [[Kannazuki Genshi]]. 

She has two forms: humanoid form and cat form. Originally she was a black cat who is addicted to eating strawberry to the point she become a pink cat and able to speak human language. After sometime she evolved into a humanoid form. She has two personalities depending on her eyes color (red eyes for fiery personality but that eyes were formerly yellow, blue eyes for her normal persona of cuteness and friendliness).

title: elira_pendora_(4th_costume)
body:
The 4th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[Nijisanji EN]]'s [[Elira Pendora]].

Dressing up for her [[birthday]], she now has a [[very long hair|very long]] [[straight hair|straight]] [[blue hair]] [[multicolored hair|with]] [[white hair|white]] [[colored inner hair|inner hair colored]], a [[black headband|black]] [[headband]] that created [[hair intakes]], four [[hairpin|hairpins]] with two of them in the shape of a [[cloud]] and [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]], and a [[white ribbon|white]] [[ribbon]] that tied to the back of her [[blue wings|blue]] [[head wings]]. She also goes back to [[hair over one eye|covering her left eye]] with her [[long bangs|long bang]]. She can also alternatively have [[medium hair|medium-length]] hair.

It consists of a [[black choker|black]] [[choker]], a [[long sleeves]], [[open collar|open]]-[[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] with [[buttoned cuffs]], and a [[clothing cutout|cutout]] in the [[center opening|middle]] of the [[shirt]], revealing her [[large breasts|breasts]] with a [[cleavage cutout]] and [[framed breasts]] that have a green [[tag]] attached to the left side with "xxx" written on it. A [[string]] is also tied around the [[shirt]] [[collared_shirt|collar]] with a [[padlock|pad]][[lock]] locked onto the [[string]] that also has "xxx" written on it. On her [[jacket on shoulders|shoulder]], she wore a [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]] with [[notched lapels|notched]] [[lapels]] and a [[lapel pin]] that shaped like a cat (or [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]]). On the left arm sleeves of the [[grey jacket|grey]] [[jacket]], she wore a grey [[armband]] that had "3W1W4" written on it (similar to her "sub-Twitter account username":[https://twitter.com/3W1W4]). On top of her [[shirt]], she wore a body [[harness]] that looked like a [[chest harness|chest]] [[harness]] (worn [[underbust|underneath her breasts]]) with [[suspenders]]. She also wore [[black gloves|black]] and [[white gloves|white]] [[gloves]] with a [[heart cutout|heart]] [[clothing cutout|cutout]] on the back of the [[gloves]] and a [[wristwatch|wrist]][[watch]] on her left wrist. 

For her [[lower body]], she wore [[grey pants|grey]] [[pants]] with a [[belt]] that has a [[belt buckle|belt]] [[buckle]]. On her right leg, she wore a [[thigh strap]] with [[thigh pouch|thigh]] [[pouch]] used for storing her "DBJ" (Dumb Bitch Juice) [[juice box]], while on her left leg, she had a [[charm (object)|]] of [[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]] with a [[purple ribbon|purple]] [[ribbon]] that had "[[famelira (elira pendora)|weewa]]" written on it attached to the [[belt]] with an [[o-ring]]. For her footwear, she wore a [[grey footwear|grey]] [[high heels|heels]] with a [[white socks|white]] [[socks]]. Her [[wings]] are also [[white wings|white]] now to match the theme.

[[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] also got a new [[official alternate costume|costume]], wearing a [[long sleeves|long-sleeved]] [[collared_shirt|collared]] [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]] (also has [[buttoned cuffs]]) with a [[traditional bowtie|traditional]] [[purple bowtie|purple]] [[bowtie]] and a [[white vest|white]] [[vest]] on top of the [[shirt]]. For its eyewear, [[Pikl (elira pendora)|]] wore [[white-framed eyewear|white]], [[rectangular eyewear|rectangular]] [[glasses]].

h4. Appearance

* !post #6793700: Profile
* !post #8267282: Merchandise

h4. Related tags
[tn](Due to the nature of the costume and no actual reference sheet, these tags may or may not apply depending on the post)[/tn]

* [[aqua eyes]]
* [[bridgeless bra]] (use either this or [[framed breasts]] depending on the post)

* [[keyhole]] (when the [[padlock]] [[keyhole]] is visible)

* [[no jacket]] ([[Elira Pendora|Elira]] has a toggle to remove her jacket)
* [[open clothes]]

title: zentreya
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. Started out as a [[VRChat]] roleplayer before becoming a full VTuber, and while initially an [[indie virtual youtuber|indie]], she later became one of the founding members of [[VShojo]]. For privacy reasons, she doesn't broadcast her real voice on stream, instead using a chain of speech-to-text and text-to-speech software.

She has 2 different [[official alternate hairstyle|hairstyles]], depending on what model she uses:
* For her dragon model, she has [[long hair|long]] [[red hair]] that is sometimes tied into a [[ponytail]]
* For her cyborg model, she has [[short hair|short]] [[grey hair]] with [[sidelocks]]

title: fire_emblem_heroes
body:
[b]Fire Emblem Heroes[/b] (ファイアーエムブレムヒーローズ [i]Faiaa Emuburemu Hiiroozu[/i]) is a turn-based strategy mobile app based on the [i][[Fire Emblem]][/i] series published by [[Nintendo]]. It is the series' first step into the mobile platform. The story revolves around the fight between the Emblian Empire, whose desire is to take over all worlds, and the kingdom of Askr, who opposes them. To fight back, a [[kiran_(fire_emblem)|Summoner]] capable of summoning heroes from different worlds was called from our world by [[anna_(fire_emblem)|Anna]]. As the Summoner, the player must call forth the various heroes of [i]Fire Emblem[/i] and devise strategies for them as a tactician. h4. Characters h5. Main

h5. Featured Heroes * See [[List of Fire Emblem Characters]]. h5. Hero Classifications At the time of writing, Heroes in the game can be grouped into the following types: [expand] * Regular: Refers to Heroes in their standard, default versions. Often as they'd be seen during their respective games. ** Fallen: Refers to Heroes as corrupted versions of their regular selves. The game treats them as regular Heroes for many purposes. ** Brave: Refers to Heroes as idealized versions of themselves manifested by the imagination of the people. Determined each year by voting, their appearance, personality and weapons vary greatly. The game treats them as regular Heroes for summoning purposes but as Special Heroes for others. ** Resplendent: Refers to Heroes (Regular or Brave) wearing special regalia associated to one of the game-original kingdoms. * Special: Catch-all term used to refer to Heroes wearing costumes themed after various festivities or events, be they game-specific or game-equivalents. ** Day of Devotion (Valentine's Day equivalent) ** Spring (Easter equivalent) ** Bridal (self-explanatory) ** Children (loli/shota versions) ** Desert Festival (themed around desert locales from different games) ** Wind Festival (themed around wind tribes) ** Flame Festival (themed around flame tribes) ** Picnic (has not been re-used) ** Hot Springs (has not been re-used) ** Summer (Swimsuits) ** Harvest Festival (Halloween/Oktoberfest equivalent) ** Thief Festival (themed around phantom thieves) ** Ninja Festival (self-explanatory) ** Pirate Festival (self-explanatory) ** Day of 12 (has not been re-used; game-specific) ** Winter Festival (Christmas equivalent) ** New Year's (self-explanatory) * Legendary: Refers to Heroes typically in their end-game states. * Mythic: Refers to Heroes that are myths from their own timelines (gods, progenitors etc) or FEH-original characters * Emblem: Refers to Heroes that are protagonists of mainline games as interpreted within [[Fire Emblem Engage|Engage]]'s system, where they're spirits/stands existing wtihin special rings. * Rearmed: Refers to Heroes wielding special, cursed weapons. Valuable in-game due to their special properties during inheritance. * Attuned: Refers to Heroes wielding special skills. Valuable in-game due to their special properties during inheritance. * Ascended: Refers to Heroes often in their post-game state. Valuble in-game due to brining extremely-limited items with them. [/expand] h4. External Links * "Official Website":https://fire-emblem-heroes.com/ * "Official Twitter (JP)":https://twitter.com/fe_heroes_jp * "Fire Emblem Heroes Wiki":[https://feheroes.gamepedia.com/Main_Page] * "Wikipedia: Fire Emblem Heroes":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fire_Emblem_Heroes]

title: ultraman_80
body:
The titular Ultra of [[Ultraman 80 (series)|]]. His human form is [[Yamato Takeshi]]. 80 was a teacher at the Sakura-ga-Oka Middle School. He theorized that monsters originated from Minus Energy, which is created from the negative emotions of humans. 80 is a well known teacher from the Land of Light and was the last Ultra Warrior assigned to protect Earth in the M78 timeline until [[Ultraman Mebius]]' arrival in 2006.

title: eren_yeager
body:
The main character of [[Shingeki no Kyojin]].

The 5th best trainee from the 104th Trainees Squad. No particular skills besides his excellent close combat ability and strong sense of purpose. An impulsive and violent young man, his dream is to annihilate all Titans and discover the world outside the walls. [[Mikasa Ackerman]] is his adopted sister, as her parents have passed away. He's good friends with [[Armin Arlert]].

Voiced by [[Kaji Yuuki]].

title: volunteer_army_(russia)
body:
The [b]Russian Volunteer Army[/b] was a White movement force in the Russian Civil War (1917–1920), initially formed in Novocherkassk with 3,000–4,000 volunteers. Founded in December 1917 by General [[Mikhail Alekseyev]] and General [[Lavr Kornilov]], it fought the Bolsheviks in South Russia, including during the "Ice March" and Kuban Offensive. [[Anton Denikin]] took command after Kornilov’s death in 1918, peaking at 40,000 troops in 1919 before its evacuation under [[Pyotr Wrangel]] in 1920.

They are recognisable through the [[russian_flag|Russian tricolour]] [[chevron_(symbol)|chevron]] they don on their sleeve.

h4. See Also

[[Imperial Russian Army]]
[[Russian Civil War]]
[[White Army]]

title: kornilov_shock_regiment
body:
The [b]Kornilov Shock Regiment[/b] was an elite unit of the [[Imperial Russian Army]] formed during [[World War I]], later becoming a cornerstone of the [[White Army]] in the [[Russian Civil War]]. Established in June 1917 under [[Lavr Kornilov]], commander of the Russian Eighth Army, it began as the 1st Shock Detachment to counter the crumbling discipline of the post-February Revolution army. Initiated by [[Aleksei Brusilov]]’s call for "revolutionary shock battalions," the unit was renamed in Kornilov’s honor in August 1917 and became known for its fierce loyalty and combat prowess.

Led initially by Captain [[Mitrofan Nezhentsev]], the regiment grew from a volunteer force of officers and soldiers into a symbol of anti-Bolshevik resistance. After the [[October Revolution]], it joined Lavr Kornilov in southern Russia, becoming one of the first units of the Volunteer Army alongside generals like [[Mikhail Alekseyev]] and [[Anton Denikin]]. The regiment fought in major campaigns, including the [[Ice March of 1918]], where Kornilov died in battle. It later expanded into a brigade and division, enduring heavy losses until its evacuation from Crimea in 1920 under [[Pyotr Wrangel]].

The Kornilovites were renowned for their distinctive red-and-black uniforms and skull-and-crossbones insignia, reflecting their oath to fight to the death. They clashed repeatedly with the [[soviet_army|Red Army]], led by figures like [[Leon Trotsky]], and remained a disciplined force amid the chaos of civil war.

h4. Common Themes
Depictions often include:

* Soldiers in red-and-black [[peaked cap|peaked caps]] and [[shoulder boards]] with a white "K."
* [[Skull and crossbones]] patches, symbolising their commitment to sacrifice.

h4. See Also

[[Imperial Russian Army]] - The regiment’s origins in World War I.
[[Russian Civil War]] - The conflict where it gained prominence.
[[volunteer_army_(russia)|Volunteer Army]] - The White force it helped establish.
[[White Army]] - The broader anti-Bolshevik movement.

title: komori_met_(5th_costume)
body:
The fifth [[official alternate costume|costume]] and second default of [[VSPO!]]'s [[Komori Met]], her first upon joining VSPO, replacing her original [[komori met (1st costume)|default]].

She's wearing a [[black hat|black]] [[cat hat]], a [[single strap|single strapped]] [[crop top]] covered in [[two-tone jacket|red and brown]], [[cropped jacket|cropped]] [[bomber jacket]], with the inside part [[quilted jacket|quilted]], and [[puffy long sleeves]]. She's wearing a [[single fingerless glove|single]] [[black gloves|black]] [[partially fingerless gloves|partially fingerless glove]].
Below, she's wearing a [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts|shorts]], [[brown belt]], a visible single [[panty straps|panty strap]] on her left-hand side of the waist, a single [[garter straps|garter strap]] and a [[single thighhigh|single]] [[fishnet thighhighs|fishnet thighhigh]] on her left leg while wearing [[asymmetrical legwear|different thing]] for the right leg, as it is bare with markings on the upper part, with a [[single boot|single]] [[ankle boots| ankle boot]]. 

h4. Appearance

* !post #6622988: Jacket on
* !post #6623009: Jacket off

h4. External links

title: imperial_russian_army
body:
The [b]Imperial Russian Army[/b] was the land armed forces of the [[Russian Empire]], active from the early 18th century until its dissolution in 1917 during the [[Russian Revolution]]. Established under [[Peter the Great]], it grew into one of the largest and most formidable armies in Europe, playing a key role in conflicts like the [[Napoleonic Wars]], the [[Russo-Turkish Wars]], and [[World War I]].

Under Peter the Great, the army modernised with a standing force, moving away from reliance on irregular troops. Later rulers, such as [[Catherine the Great]], expanded its reach and influence. By the 19th century, commanders like [[Mikhail Kutuzov]] led it to victory against [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] in 1812, cementing its reputation. In World War I, under [[Nicholas II]], the army initially mobilised millions but faced heavy losses and logistical failures, contributing to its collapse during the 1917 upheavals.

The Imperial Russian Army was known for its vast conscripted ranks, including infantry, cavalry, and artillery units. It ceased to exist after the Bolsheviks, led by [[Vladimir Lenin]], overthrew the monarchy, with many of its remnants joining the [[White Army]] in the [[Russian Civil War]].

h4. See Also

[[Russian Revolution]] - The event that ended the Imperial Russian Army.
[[Russian Civil War]] - Where its remnants fought as the White Army.
[[Napoleonic Wars]] - A defining era for the army’s legacy.
[[World War I]] - Its final major conflict.
[[Cossack|Cossacks]] - Elite cavalry units of the empire.

title: russian_civil_war
body:
The [b]Russian Civil War[/b] was a multi-party conflict in the former [[Russian Empire]] from 1917 to 1922, following the chaos of the 1917 Russian Revolution. It pitted the Bolshevik-led [[soviet_army|Red Army]] against the anti-Bolshevik [[imperial_russian_army|White Army]] and various other factions, including foreign interventionists, in a brutal struggle for control of the nation.

The war erupted after the Bolsheviks, under [[Vladimir Lenin]], overthrew the Provisional Government in the [[October Revolution]]. The Red Army, organized by [[Leon Trotsky]], aimed to establish a socialist state. Opposing them was the White Army, a coalition of monarchists, liberals, and anti-Bolshevik socialists, led by figures like [[Alexander Kolchak]] and [[Anton Denikin]]. Other groups, such as the anarchist Black Army led by [[Nestor Makhno]] and the peasant [[Green_Army|Green Armies]], fought against both major sides.

Foreign powers also played a role, with the Allied nations (Britain, France, and the United States) and the Central Powers (Germany) intervening at various points. Key moments, like the [[Battle of Tsaritsyn]] influenced by [[Joseph Stalin]], shaped the conflict’s course. The war ended in 1922 with a Bolshevik victory, laying the foundation for the [[Soviet Union]].

title: acheron_(izumo)_(honkai:_star_rail)
body:
An [[official alternate costume]] worn by [[Acheron (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] during the events of the fall of Izumo.

Her outfit is officially revealed in [Myriad Celestia Trailer — "Kyoden: A Cleave Across the Transient World"](https://youtu.be/Z3aWHMg92_U) and can be seen once more [spoiler]in-game at the end of Penacony's main story. While saying goodbye to Acheron, there is a special dialogue wishing the [[Trailblazer (Honkai: Star Rail)|]] well on their future adventures.[/spoiler] 

She is portrayed with a slightly darker shade for her long [[purple hair]], with the most obvious difference being the presence of [[red horns|red]] oni horns reminiscent of the [[Raiden Mei (Herrscher of Thunder)|Herrscher of Thunder]]. Her outfit consists of a [[white kimono]] with a [[red sash|red]] [[obi]].

title: rejection_reaction_(meme)
body:
[tn]Meme name still pending[/tn]

A facial expression of amazement and shock.

During an [[Apex Legends]] stream, [[Dokibird (vtuber)|]] was grouped up with two other players who knew each other and were talking in voice chat.
The atmosphere started somewhat intimate with Dokibird quietly listening in on the conversation, until one person asked if the other one was still with someone else.
The answer was "[I]Yeah. He is right next to me [...][/I]" at which point the atmosphere dramatically shifted to awkward. The clip went viral, with Doki's exaggerated expression becoming a topic of redraws and discussion about advancements in VTuber model tracking.

h4. Screenshot

* !asset #22681911

h4. External links

* "YouTube:【PC STRESS TEST】i ended up with 2 different sets of faulty ram【Dokibird】@ 37:50":[https://www.youtube.com/live/wEHNmDagYGQ?&t=2270]
* "Twitter: i can't believe me and my chat just watch a man get rejected live on apex legends 🍺drinks out for that guy":[https://twitter.com/dokibird/status/1821417055033180304]

title: the_town_with_no_name
body:
[b]The Town with No Name[/b] is a 1992 Western adventure game for the Commodore Amiga CDTV, made by Delta 4 Interactive and published by On-Line Entertainment. The player controls a nameless [[drifter (town with no name)|]] and alternates between visiting a location in town and engaging in a gunfight against a member of a bandit gang.

The game is infamous for its minimal gameplay and its bizarre cutscenes, in particular '[[give me a drink bartender (meme)|]]'.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Town_with_No_Name]
* "Give me a drink, bartender (YouTube)":[https://youtu.be/T28LyXf8MlU]
other_names: ザ・タウン・ウィズ・ノーネーム

title: give_me_a_drink_bartender_(meme)
body:
A scene from [[The Town With No Name]]. In the scene, the [[drifter (town with no name)|protagonist]] asks a [[bartender]] for a drink, and the bartender dramatically slides it to the protagonist. The player must click on the drink as it slides past in order to catch it, but doing so is notoriously difficult, and failing causes it to shatter on the floor.

h4. External links

* "YouTube":[https://youtu.be/T28LyXf8MlU]

title: somebody_that_i_used_to_know
body:
[b]Somebody That I Used to Know[/b] is a 2011 song by Australian singer Gotye, featuring vocals from New Zealand singer Kimbra. The song was a global hit for both Gotye and Kimbra and won several music awards including two Grammys.

The song later gained [[meme]]tic status due to its frequent use in "Lore" meme videos.

title: asano_brigade
body:
After the [[Russian Civil War]], White Russian émigrés in [[Manchuria]] were recruited by [[Japan]] to form an anti-Soviet force within the [[Manchurian_imperial_army|Manchukuo Army]]. Conscription began in 1940, targeting all ethnicities, including Russians, who initially guarded railways. Partnering with [[Konstantin Rodzaevsky]]’s [[Russian Fascist Party]], Japan unified these troops in 1936 under the [b]Asano Detachment[/b] (later [b]Asano Brigade[/b]), led by Colonel [[Asano Takashi]]. 

Starting with 200 men, it grew to 700 across five companies by 1938, fighting in the Battle of Khalkhin Gol, where it was nearly wiped out. A rebuilt brigade reached 4,000 by 1945, including [[cossack|Cossacks]], and clashed with the [[soviet army|Red Army]] during the Soviet invasion of Manchuria; some surrendered, while the fate of captives remains unclear. 

Members learned Japanese, followed Bushido, and by 1941 included three cavalry squadrons. A 1942 military school trained Russian officers, though service was unpopular in Harbin’s émigré community. Reorganized in 1944 into three detachments, the brigade blended Russian and Manchukuo symbols, with more Russian officers than before

title: manchurian_imperial_army
body:
The [b]Manchurian Imperial Army[/b] was the ground force of [[Manchukuo]], a Japanese puppet state in northeastern [[China]] from 1932 to 1945. Established after the Japanese invasion of Manchuria, it initially comprised former Chinese troops under [[Zhang Xueliang]], later expanding to include Han Chinese, Manchus, Mongols, Koreans, Japanese, and White Russians. 

Peaking at 170,000–220,000 soldiers by 1945, it fought [[chinese_workers'_and_peasants'_red_army|Communist]] and [[national_revolutionary_army|Nationalist]] guerrillas and the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] [[soviet_army|Red Army]].

Led by [[aisin-gioro_puyi|Emperor Puyi]], it relied heavily on Japanese support, with cavalry as its main strength, though it was ultimately outmatched by the Soviets in the 1945 Manchurian Strategic Offensive Operation.

h4. Insignia

* !asset #25424238: War flag of Manchukuo
* !asset #25424223: Five-colored star army insignia

h4. See also:

* [[Asano Brigade]]

title: kowai_tsuriko
body:
Original character originating on [[4chan]].

Tsuriko Kowai is a normal highschool student, apart from the fact that she's a head shorter than her classmates and has a reputation for being "the cute one." She longs to break out of her role by trying to be mean to her classmates and make them take her seriously. Much to her dismay, though, she comes off as even cuter than usual and only ends up trolling herself in every way conceivable. This series is about Yuki's various schemes against her classmates and their inevitable backfiring.

h4. External links

* [code]http://s4.zetaboards.com/Adoratroll/index/[/code] [i](dead link)[/i]

body:
A [[VSPO!]] [[virtual YouTuber|VTuber]]. 

She is portrayed with [[long hair|long]] [[black hair]] with a side [[braid]] and [[blue hair|blue]] [[streaked hair|streaks]], and [[purple eyes]].

h4. Costumes

h5. Official costumes with a model

* !post #4480229: [[Ichinose Uruha (1st costume)|Original default]]
* !post #7331752: [[Ichinose Uruha (2nd costume)|Current default]]: Casual
* !post #7880503: [[Ichinose Uruha (3rd costume)|3rd costume]]: Kimono
* !post #8607436: [[Ichinose Uruha (4th costume)|4th costume]]: Street
* !post #6431198: [[Ichinose Uruha (5th costume)|5th costume]]: Dress
* !post #8236632: [[Ichinose Uruha (6th costume)|6th costume]]: School

h5. Other costumes

* !post #6599857: [[Ichinose Uruha (Summer C102)]]: Illustration-only swimsuit

title: cube_tom_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] originated from a popular visual gag from [[Tom and Jerry]].

The scene involves [[Tom (tom and Jerry)|]] being tricked by [[Jerry (tom and jerry)|]] into running into a [[safe (container)|]] with such force that when he comes out, he transformed into a [[cube]].

h5. Origin:
* !asset #24033114

h4. See also
* [[Triangle Jerry (meme)]]

title: triangle_jerry_(meme)
body:
A [[Meme]] originated from a popular visual gag from [[Tom and Jerry]].

The scene involves [[Jerry (tom and Jerry)|]] eating a [[swiss cheese]] wedge that is larger than himself in one go, transforming him into a [[triangle]].

h5. Origin:
* !asset #25420652

h4. See also
* [[Cube Tom (meme)]]

title: justin_bailey
body:
A version of [[Samus Aran]] with [[brown hair]] or [[green hair]] and either a [[pink leotard]] or a [[pink bikini]].

Featured in the original [[Metroid (classic)|]] game, where entering the password [code]JUSTIN BAILEY[/code] would unlock this outfit. Completing the game as "Justin Bailey" would result in the bikini image normally reserved for completing the game in under an hour.

h4. Appearance
* !asset #23453139: Ending screen for [[Metroid (classic)|]] (Leotard)
* !asset #25423853: Ending screen for [[Metroid (classic)|]] (Bikini)
* !asset #23453132: Ending screen for [[Metroid: Samus Returns]] on the hardest difficulty
other_names: ジャスティン・ベイリー

title: ninomae_ina'nis
body:
A [[Virtual YouTuber|VTuber]] and member of [[hololive English]]'s [[holoMyth|1st generation]]. Designed by [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]].

She has [[pointy ears]], a [[mole under eye|mole under her right eye]] a pointy [[fang]] and a [[flat chest]] (much to her dismay), as well as two "ear"-like protrusions sticking out of her hair (a reference to similar flaps in some cephalopods), and pair of [[white wings|white]] [[low wings|low]] [[feathered wings]] wrapped around her waist. When in her "full" form she gets a [[halo]] above her head and several large [[tentacles]] on her back.

She has [[blue eyes|blue]] or [[grey eyes]] and [[very long hair|very long]], [[straight hair|straight]] [[purple hair|dark purple]]/[[black hair]] with two short [[sidelocks]] that turn into [[gradient hair|gradient]] [[orange hair|orange]] [[tentacle hair|tentacles]] and [[blunt bangs]] in a [[center-flap bangs|center flap]].

h4. Costumes

title: shantae
body:
Main character of the [[shantae (series)|Shantae series]]. A guardian half-genie whose job it is to protect Scuttle Town from danger, which is often pirate attacks from [[Risky Boots]]. Her main method of attack is her long hair which she uses as a whip and she performs various magical dances to transform into various [[alternate form|forms]].

Shantae is a [[belly dancing|belly]] [[dancer]] who usually dons a bedlah. Her attire consists of a red [[o-ring top]] with a matching pair of [[harem pants]] and [[red footwear|red]] [[pointy footwear|pointy shoes]]. Gold [[jewelry]] has a significant role in her design with a [[hair ornament]] that gives her a [[high ponytail]], a pair of [[bracer]]s, [[hoop earrings]], and a [[circlet]]. She also wears a [[purple choker]] to match her [[very long hair|very long]] [[purple hair]].

[[uncle mimic|Mimic]] is her adopted uncle.

h4. Appearance

* !post #1500487: Default
* !post #2121966: [[shantae: risky's revenge|Risky's Revenge]]
* !post #2151314: [[shantae and the pirate's curse|Pirate's Curse]]
* !post #2151320: Pirate Shantae ([[shantae and the pirate's curse|Pirate's Curse]])

h4. See also

* [[Dancer Shantae]]

title: tinkerbat
body:
[[Pirate]]s under the command of [[Risky Boots]]. They loyally follow her every order and do her bidding. Though they are intelligent they [[no_mouth|lack a mouth]] to speak. 

They are completely [[black skin|black]] like shadows, have [[black eyes]] and [[yellow sclera]]. They're also topless with only [[red pants]] and a [[red bandana]] as apparel.

h4. See also
* [[Cacklebat]]

title: vela_(trickcal)
body: A character in [[trickcal|Trickcal/Trickcal Revive]].

title: zebesian
body:
[[Alien]] enemies that appear in [[Super Metroid]], [[Metroid Fusion]], [[Metroid: Zero Mission]] and [[Metroid: Other M]]. 

An upright creature with a carapace and claw hands that can shoot lasers. They come in a variety of colors, and are a central force of the [[Space Pirate (metroid)|]]s. They are found primarily on the planet Zebes, but only inherited the name by conquering it. 

Not every space pirate is a Zebesian, however. The names of the alien races composing other pirate forces are not known.

h4. Official Art
* !asset #25423557

title: tom_and_jerry
body:
An American slapstick comedy cartoon, originally produced by [[Hanna-Barbera|William Hanna and Joseph Barbera]]. First aired theatrically in 1940.

The story revolves around [[Tom (Tom and Jerry)|]], a blue cat, and [[Jerry (Tom and Jerry)|]], an orange mouse, and their antics, which generally involve one of the two getting hurt in a neverending feud.

h4. See also

* [[Cube Tom (meme)|]]
* [[Polish Jerry (meme)|]]
* [[that goddamn cat (meme)|]]
* [[Tom Chin Cheng Hanji (meme)|]]
* [[Tom reading the Newspaper (meme)|]]
* [[Triangle Jerry (meme)|]]
* [[Tom and Jerry: Chase]]

title: jerry_(tom_and_jerry)
body:
One of the two titular characters from the [[Tom and Jerry]] cartoon series. Jerry is an anthromorphic orange [[rat|mouse]] and a "frenemy" of [[Tom (tom and jerry)|]]. He is often involved into a chase with Tom due to his habit of snacking on Tom's owner's food, particularly [[swiss cheese]]. 

h4. See also

* [[Polish Jerry (meme)]]
* [[Triangle Jerry (meme)]]
other_names: ジェリー(トムとジェリー)

title: handgun
body:
A short-barrelled [[gun|firearm]] designed to be used with one hand or [[two-handed|two hands]] and for shooting at short-ranged targets, while be more concealable to be [[holstered]] than a [[rifle]] or a [[submachine gun]]. Its [[ammunition]] feeding mechanism may vary by design, such as muzzle-loading earlier handguns, [[break action]], by using [[clip (weapon)|clips]] or more commonly [[magazine (weapon)|magazines]].

Handgun types include modern semi-automatic pistols, [[revolver]]s, [[antique firearm]]s such as [[flintlock]]s and [[derringer]]s. This tag also covers the "machine pistol", a handgun capable of fully automatic fire (e.g. [[Beretta 93R]]).

The term "pistol" refers to handguns with a single, stationary (non-revolving) chamber.  In Danbooru, the "pistol" tag redirects to the "handgun" tag.

For the hand gesture imitating a gun, use [[finger gun]] instead.

h4. Examples

* !post #6736099: Semi-automatic handgun
* !post #6229047: [[Revolver]]

h4. See also

* [[dual wielding]]
* [[flare gun]]
* [[locked slide]]
* [[List of Weapons]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Handgun":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Handgun]
other_names: オートマチックピストル

title: risky_boots
body:
Recurring antagonist of the [[Shantae (series)|]] series and arch-nemesis of [[Shantae]]. 

A greedy, nefarious [[pirate]] and self-proclaimed "Queen of the Seven Seas". She commands an army of [[Tinkerbat]]s to raid Sequin Land and frequently attacks Shantae's home, Scuttle Town. 

Has [[purple skin|purple]]/[[blue skin]], [[purple hair]], and [[red eyes]]. She wears a [[purple headwear|purple]] & [[red headwear|red]] [[pirate hat]] with a [[skull and crossbones]], large [[purple wrist cuffs|purple]] & [[red wrist cuffs|red]] [[wrist cuffs]] and [[purple pants|purple]] [[harem pants]] with a [[belt skirt]]. Lastly she has on a [[purple choker|purple]] [[pendant choker]], big [[hoop earrings]] and underneath her pirate hat there's a [[red bandana]].

h4. Appearance
* !asset #25422829: Default
* !post #1843066: Without Hat and Belt ([[Shantae and the Pirate's Curse]])

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(pastry_chef)
body:
The 6th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]], as seen on "Twitter":[https://twitter.com/kuroboshi/status/1774199255080870162].

It consists of a [[black dress|black]] [[short dress]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], a [[white apron|white]] [[frilled apron|frilly apron]], [[white gloves]] and [[black boots|black]] [[knee boots|knee-high boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[curly hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and her [[tentacle hair]] resembling [[hair flaps]]. Her headpiece is now grey instead of gold.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #20982284: Profile
* !post #7826453: Merchandise

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(loungewear)
body:
The 5th [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]].

It consists of a [[grey jacket|dark grey]] [[hooded jacket]] with various badges. worn over a [[white shirt|white]] [[t-shirt]] with a comic panel [[print shirt|print]] of the five [[holoMyth]] members, and [[black shorts|black]] [[short shorts]]. The outfit also comes with an optional [[Takodachi (ninomae ina'nis)|]]-styled [[slippers]] and wireless [[headphones around neck|headphones around her neck]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has her [[long hair]] cut [[short hair|short]] in a [[bob cut]]-style with [[blunt bangs]] and a [[hairclip]] with the same design as her usual headpiece. Her "hair flaps" and "squishy hair" is also significantly smaller.

h4. Appearance

* !post #6246940: Profile

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(new_year)
body:
The 4th/New Years [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]].

It is a Japanese New Year's style [[black kimono|black]] [[print kimono|print]] [[furisode]], paired with a [[black haori|black]] [[haori]], [[black gloves]], a takodachi-shaped [[kinchaku]] and [[black boots|black]] [[platform boots]]. She also has an optional [[black scarf]] that she [[enpera|tucks her heir into]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] with this costume, she has [[long hair|long]] [[straight hair]] with [[double bun|double]] [[takodachi (ninomae ina'nis)|]]-shaped [[braided bun]]s with regular long [[sidelocks]] instead of her [[tentacle hair]] (although she can move her hair tentacles to the top of her head, giving the impression of [[horns]]) and a [[hair flower]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15444827: Profile

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(party_dress)
body:
The 3rd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]].

It is based on three foreigner-class (Lovecraftian) servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]] designed by her artist [[Kuroboshi Kouhaku]]. It consists of a [[black headwear|black]] [[tilted headwear|tilted]] [[hat]], a short [[print dress]] with the same pattern as [[Katsushika Hokusai (fate)|]]'s kimono, a [[two-tone coat|two-tone]] [[black coat|black]] and [[white coat|white]] coat with [[mismatched sleeves|mismatched]] [[puffy long sleeves]] taken from [[Abigail Williams (fate)|]], and a [[Jacques de Molay (foreigner) (fate)|genderswapped Jacques de Molay]], [[mismatched gloves|mismatched]] [[black gloves|black]] and [[white gloves]] and [[black boots]].

For her [[official alternate hairstyle|official hairstyle]] in this costume, she has her done in [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[low twintails]].

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15444825: Profile

title: ninomae_ina'nis_(casual)
body:
The 2nd [[official alternate costume|costume]] of [[hololive English|hololive EN]]'s [[Ninomae Ina'nis]].

It consists of a [[pleated dress|pleated]] [[short dress|short]] [[black dress|black]] [[pinafore dress|pinafore]] [[medium dress]] worn over a [[collared shirt|collared]] [[grey shirt|dark grey]] [[vertical-striped shirt|vertical-stripped]] [[pinstripe shirt]] with [[puffy long sleeves]], a black [[neck ribbon]] a [[pink bag|pink]] [[handbag]], [[grey pantyhose]] and [[black shoes|black]] [[platform footwear|platform]] [[mary janes]].

Her headpiece is black instead of gold and she wears either a [[black hat|black]] [[beret]] or a [[sideways hat|sideways]] [[flat cap]] to hold her bangs back.

h4. Appearance

* !asset #15444822: Profile

title: silvers_rayleigh
body:
[[One Piece]] character. "Dark King" Silvers Rayleigh is the first mate of [[Gol D. Roger]]'s crew and is known as his right-hand man. He later married [[Shakuyaku (one piece)|]] and lived his retirement as a coating mechanic on Sabaody. 

He is highly competent in using [[Haki (one piece)|]] not unlike his (former) captain. He served as the mentor of [[Monkey D. Luffy]] to help him mastering the usage of Haki during the timeskip.
other_names: シルバーズ・レイリー

title: tsugami_shouichi
body:
Amnesiac young man, who has been adopted the addressed name on a letter found in his possession when he washed ashore. A generous, simple, all-around nice guy, he lives with the Misugi family and does all of the household chores. Using the Altering belt, Shouichi can transform into [[Kamen Rider Agito]], an ancient and powerful warrior and fighter against the Unknown due to being somewhat tied to his forgotten past. As the series progressed, he discovers the reason behind his amnesia and his real name.

[spoilers]His real name's revealed to be "[b]Sawaki Tetsuya.[/b]" He attempted to contact Tsugami Shouichi, his sister's lover, to find out about her suicide via the letter she wrote for Shouichi. With his search leading him aboard a ferry called the Akatsuki. The El of Water arrived at Akatsuki and assaulted Tetsuya, sensing his churning power, but just as the final blow was about to be dealt, Tetsuya transformed into Agito for the first time. The ensuing battle ended with Tetsuya being tossed overboard, where he was labeled "lost-at-sea" by the authorities. Tetsuya survived and washed ashore but was left with amnesia. He's found by a trio of schoolgirls and brought to the hospital to be cared for by Dr. Azuma Kunieda, and going by the name on the letter in his possession, he assumed the alias of Tsugami Shouichi, who had died at the time, while the real Shouichi was resurrected and assumed the alias of Sawaki Tetsuya, switching their names in the process.[/spoilers]

title: edward_newgate
body:
[[One Piece]] character. "Whitebeard" is the captain of the [[Whitebeard Pirates]], one of the Four Emperors, the rival and friend of the late Pirate King [[Gol D. Roger]], and known as the strongest man in the world.

Having consumed the Gura Gura no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], he has the power to create shockwaves, spawning earthquakes and tsunamis, and even "cracking" the air itself.

[spoiler]In the battle at [[Marineford]], he was killed by [[Marshall D. Teach|"Blackbeard"]], who took his power and title for himself.[/spoiler]

h4. See also

* [[The One Piece is real (meme)]]

title: jewelry_bonney
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the [[Eleven Supernova]]. "Big Eater" Jewelry Bonney is the captain of the Bonney Pirates. [spoiler]She is the adoptive daughter of [[Bartholomew Kuma]].[/spoiler]

Having consumed the Toshi Toshi no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she has the power to alter peoples' physical age as well as her own. [spoiler]With her true age being actually just 12 years old.[/spoiler] She can also transform into a "what-if" version of herself, allowing her to copy the power of the other Devil Fruit users.

title: perona
body:
[[One Piece]] character. One of the "mysterious four", "Ghost Princess" Perona commanded the Wild and Surprise zombies aboard [[Thriller Bark]]. Commonly seen with her pet zombie/stuffed toy [[Kumacy]].

Having consumed the Horo Horo no Mi [[Devil Fruit]], she can create [[ghost]]s and project her spirit, in addition of being able to disable her enemy of the will to fight.

Perona is frequently grouped together with [[Roronoa Zoro]] and [[Dracule Mihawk]] due to them having lived on the latter's private island during the timeskip, with her only leaving the island after Mihawk told her about the impending dissolution of the [[Shichibukai]].

title: shanks_(one_piece)
body:
A character of [i][[One Piece]][/i]. Captain of the "Red-hair Pirates", he used to be a crew member of "Pirate King" [[Gol D. Roger|Gol D. Roger]]. He was the one who gave [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] his signature straw hat and inspired him to become a pirate after he lost his left arm in a fight against a Sea King to protect young Luffy.

He's later revealed to be one of the "Four Emperors", world's four greatest pirates, along with "Whitebeard" [[Edward Newgate]], "Big Mom" [[Charlotte Linlin]] and "[[Kaidou (one piece)|]] of the Beasts".

Unlike the other Emperors, Shanks does not possesses any [[Devil Fruit]] power. However, he is an immensely skilled [[Haki (one piece)|]] users. Having mastered all three types of Haki and used them to great effect in battle. In addition, he is a highly skilled swordsman, to the point that he is capable of contending with [[Dracule Mihawk]], the "world's strongest swordsman" as one of his rival even after he lost his left arm.

[spoiler]
The original owner of the straw hat is his former captain, Gol D. Roger.
[/spoiler]

h4. See also
* [spoiler][[Figarland Shamrock]][/spoiler]

title: a-q_(madoka_magica)
body:
A character from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica Magia Exedra]].

They are the player's assistant/guide-type character, and are of the same species as [[Kyubey]], looking similar but with green accents instead of pink, and without the rings. Unlike most incubators, they are capable of feeling emotions and tries to help explain them to the player. They get very upset when compared to Kyubey.

They share a voice actress with [[Alina Gray]], leading fans to theorize they are connected in some way.

title: hand_of_god
body:
A famous goal scored by [[Diego Maradona]] against the [[England]] team at the [[1986 FIFA World Cup]] quarter-final, in which he used his hand to punch the ball into the net.

This incident came at a time when the [[United Kingdom]] and [[Argentina]]'s tensions were hot following the [[Falklands War]], and Argentina's victory was seen as revenge for that war.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Argentina v. England (1986 FIFA World Cup)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Argentina_v_England_(1986_FIFA_World_Cup)]
* "YouTube: Maradona 'Hand of God' Goal":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-ccNkksrfls]

title: kishima_kouma
body:
A character in [[Kagetsu Tooya]] and [[Melty Blood]]. 

He is the eldest son of the Kishima family, a branch of the Tohno family facing extinction and harboring extremely strong [[oni]] blood, rendering him more nonhuman than human. He wields immense herculean power and has scorching [[fire|flames]]. He was ordered by [spoiler]Tohno Makihisa[/spoiler] to be an accessory to the annihilation of the Nanaya clan, resulting in a decisive battle against [[Nanaya Kiri]], killing him in the process.

He is a [[muscular_male|muscular man]] with [[black eyes]], dark [[blue_hair|blue]] or [[black hair]] and [[hair over one eye]]. He wears [[fingerless gloves|fingerless]] [[black gloves]], [[black pants]] with [[toeless legwear]] underneath and a [[chinese clothes|chinese]] [[sleeveless_shirt|sleeveless]] [[black shirt]]. And he sometimes has on a [[fur-trimmed_coat|fur trimmed]] [[white coat]].

Despite still being alive and living in seclusion away from humanity, in the Melty Blood series another version of him still manifests as a [[wallachia|TATARI]], with little self awareness.

h4. Official art
* !post #8194469

title: assassination_of_john_f._kennedy
body:
On 22 November, 1963, [[John F. Kennedy]], the 35th president of the [[United States]], was [[assassination|assassinated]] while riding in a presidential motorcade through Dealey Plaza in Dallas, [[Texas]], when he was shot by Lee Harvey Oswald, a former U.S. Marine.

As Oswald was murdered two days later by Jack Ruby (who swore revenge against him after the assassination), the event has spawned numerous conspiracy theories, ranging from the motive behind Oswald (and Ruby to an extent), that it was an outside job that Oswald has no involvement in, or that it was an inside job by those who are disapproval of JFK's sweeping civil rights reform.

Much like the later [[9/11]], the event (more specifically the image of moments before Kennedy was shot) has become a part of "Gen Z humor" as a dark humor punchline for shock value.

title: historical_event
body:
Pictures based on, or depicting, historical events. From ancient history to yesterday, any depiction of a noteworthy event should use this tag. Artist commentaries can sometimes prove useful for identifying such entries.

This tag is only for images that [b]directly[/b] depict actual historical events, or made a clear reference to it. For images that either indirectly depict an event or feature characters connected due to the shared history of their real life counterparts, use [[historical connection]] instead.

As such, do not use this tag for:
* Posts featuring characters with a [[historical connection]] performing fictional actions
* Posts featuring characters simply dressed in period-correct attire without depicting a real event 

h4. See also
* [[Historical connection]]
* [[Historical name connection]]
* [[tag group:history]]
* "pool:Wow That Was Fast":/pools/1823
* "pool:Current Events":/pools/5960

title: shimakaze_(destroyer)
body:
The [i]Shimakaze[/i] (島風, literally "Island Wind") was a unique destroyer of the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] that first launched in July 1942. The [i]Shimakaze[/i] was an experimental design best known for its very high top speed of over 40 knots (46 mph, 74 kph). It was sunk in the "Battle of Ormoc Bay":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Ormoc_Bay on November 11, 1944. 

h4. Links

* [[Shimakaze (Kancolle)]]
* [[Shimakaze (Azur Lane)]]

* "Pixpedia entry":http://dic.pixiv.net/a/島風

title: akizuki_(destroyer)
body:
Refers to the real-life Imperial Japanese Navy destroyer [i]Akizuki[/i]. Not to be confused with the later [[Japan Maritime Self-Defense Force]] destroyer [[Akizuki (JMSDF)|DD-115]].

The lead ship/name ship of her class of anti-air destroyers (designated [b]Type B Destroyers[/b] to differentiate from the [i]Asashio[/i]/[i]Kagerou[/i]/[i]Yuugumo[/i]-class general-purpose DD [b]Type A[/b]), she was launched on 2 July 1941 and commissioned on 11 June 1942. She saw service in Guadalcanal and Philippine Sea before being sunk in the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]] on 25 October 1944.

h4. External link
* "Wikipedia: IJN [i]Akizuki[/i]":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_destroyer_Akizuki_(1941)]

title: shell
body:
A general term for the calcareous exoskeleton that protects the soft insides of many animals. Humans use them for a wide variety of purposes. 

Most commonly seen as but not limited to [[seashell]]-dwelling mollusks on Danbooru. If you aren't tagging a mollusk, it's probably also [[turtle shell]].

For the shells of [[egg|eggs]] see [[eggshell]]. For cannon projectiles, see [[artillery shell]]. For spent ammunition, see [[shell casing]].

title: exodia_the_forbidden_one
body:
A [[duel monster]] from the original [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] series. The first (and arguably most famous) "instant win" card of the franchise, which requires the user to collect all 5 cards representing his body parts (head, both arms, and both legs) in their hand, thus requiring an immense amount of luck and/or elaborate deck build to achieve this victory condition.  

Note that this tag also covers other individual "Exodia limbs", such as Left Arm of the Forbidden One or Right Leg of the Forbidden One, etc.

h4. Variants
* [[Exodia Necross]]
* [[The Unstoppable Exodia Incarnate]]

h4. See also

* [[Obliterate!!! (yu-gi-oh!)|]]

title: obliterate!!!_(yu-gi-oh!)
body:
The signature attack of [[Exodia the Forbidden One]], later receiving the namesake card for the [[duel monster]] card game.

After Exodia is successfully summoned, he performed this attack by charging an [[energy ball]] between his palms, then he unleash an [[energy beam]] from it, literally obliterating the opponent's monster and instantly win the duel.

title: gagaga_girl
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 3
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] "Spellcaster":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Spellcaster] / Effect
[b]ATK[/b] 1000
[b]DEF:[/b] 800

[b]Effect:[/b] [i]You can target 1 "[[Gagaga Magician]]" you control; this card's Level becomes the Level of that monster. An "Xyz Monster":[https://yugioh.fandom.com/wiki/Xyz_Monster] that was Summoned using only this card and other "Gagaga" monsters as Xyz Material gains this effect.
● When it is Xyz Summoned: You can target 1 Special Summoned monster your opponent controls; its ATK becomes 0.[/i]

A [[duel monster]] first debuted in [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal|Zexal]]. She is one of the disciples of [[Gagaga Magician]] and one of the signature monsters of [[Tsukumo Yuma]].

As her design is inspired by [[Dark Magician Girl]], she is frequently paired with her along with the other similar monsters.

title: nightmare_apprentice
body: A [[duel monster]] from [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]]. Nightmare Apprentice is the apprentice of [[Nightmare Magician]] and served as a key support card for the newly introduced Illusion type, with her design being inspired by [[Dark Magician Girl]].

title: dark_magician_girl
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 6
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Spellcaster / Effect
[i]This card gains 300 ATK for every [[Dark Magician]] or [[Magician of Black Chaos]] in either player's Graveyard.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2000
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700

One of the most iconic [[duel monster|duel monsters]] in the [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] franchise and one of [[Muto Yugi]]'s signature monsters. She is the Duel Spirit of [[Mana (yu-gi-oh!)|]], Mahad's apprentice ([[Mahado|Mahad]] is one of the Pharaoh's priests, whose Duel Spirit is the [[Dark Magician]]). Known as "Black Magician Girl" in Japanese.

Arguably the most famous "poster girl" of the entire franchise, Dark Magician Girl remains an inseparable part of Yu-Gi-Oh!'s identity since her debut in 2001. She has maintained her status as the most popular female character in the franchise for over 20 years, despite the introduction of many other female duel monsters since her first appearance.

title: tearlaments_kitkallos
body:
[b]Level:[/b] 5
[b]Attribute:[/b] Dark
[b]Type:[/b] Aqua / Fusion / Effect
[i]
1 "Tearlaments" monster + 1 Aqua monster
If this card is Special Summoned: You can take 1 "Tearlaments" card from your Deck, and either add it to your hand or send it to the GY. You can target 1 monster you control; Special Summon 1 "Tearlaments" monster from your hand or GY, and if you do, send the targeted monster to the GY. If this card is sent to the GY by card effect: You can send the top 5 cards of your Deck to the GY. You can only use each effect of "Tearlaments Kitkallos" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 2300
[b]DEF:[/b] 1200


Tearlaments Kitkallos is a [[mermaid]]/[[siren (mythology)|]]-themed [[duel monster]] in the Starfrost storyline. Her followers include [[Tearlaments Scheiren]], [[Tearlaments Merrli]], and [[Tearlaments Havnis]].

Tearlaments Kitkallos was brainwashed by [[Tearlaments Reinoheart]] until she stood up to him as [[Tearlaments Rulkallos]] and killed him. She was converted into [[Tearlaments Kashtira]] by [[Kashtira Riseheart]] until [[Visas Starfrost]] was purified into [[Visas Samsara]], who fused the worlds together. As a result, she became [[Mannadium Trisukta]].

There's a running gag in her fan art where she loves to snack on [[Instant Fusion]] noodles, which is a nod to how Instant Fusion is used to cheat out herself or [[El Shaddoll Winda]] in Tearlaments decks.

She's often paired up with [[Visas Starfrost]] since many believe her to be the heroine of the Visas Starfrost storyline. Otherwise, she's paired with [[Lovely Labrynth of the Silver Castle]] primarily due to a series of [[yuri]] fanarts by [[Rare Lemon]].

[b]Type:[/b] Dragon / Effect
[i]
If this card is Normal or Special Summoned: You can add 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your Deck to your hand, except "Kitchen Dragonmaid", then send 1 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand to the GY. At the start of the Battle Phase: You can return this card to the hand, and if you do, Special Summon 1 Level 8 "Dragonmaid" monster from your hand or GY. You can only use each effect of "Kitchen Dragonmaid" once per turn.[/i]

[b]ATK:[/b] 500
[b]DEF:[/b] 1700


A [[Yu-Gi-Oh!]] [[duel monster]] and one of the member of the Dragonmaid archetype. Also known as [[Dragonmaid Tinkhec]] in her dragon form. The Dragonmaid archetype's chef, as indicated by her title. She has [[red hair]], [[horns|teal horns]], red draconic wings, and a big dragon tail. 

Kitchen often depicted as a typical [[tsundere]] in some arts may be from the description that she's not used to getting compliments from Card Game Art Works. She's also drawn as got her cooked sweet stolen by [[Parlor Dragonmaid]]. Later on, she is frequently depicted as being a [[mahjong]] addict due to her being one of the eligible search target of the card "Sangen Kaimen" from the Tenpai Dragon archetype, which is themed around the aforementioned game.

title: the_lego_movie
body:
A 2014 American computer animated comedy movie by Warner Animation Group.

The plot revolves around [[Emmet Brickowski|Emmet]], an ordinary [[Lego]] minifig who one day finds the "Piece of Resistance" and, accompanied by [[Wyldstyle]] and a bunch of other Lego characters, must stop Lord Business from gluing everything in the Lego universe.

A [[The LEGO Movie 2: The Second Part|sequel]] was released in 2019.

title: lego
body:
A specific brand of [[toy block]]s invented by Ole Kirk Christansen back in 1932. The name comes from the Danish phrase [i]leg godt[/i], meaning "play well". The blocks are shaped like bricks that can interlock with each other via small plates on the top and equally-sized holes in the base, and can be accompanied with [[lego minifig|minifigs]], gears and other parts.

title: tracen_school_uniform
body:
The [[school uniform]] worn by the characters of [[Umamusume]] as well as their basic outfit.

The [[summer uniform]] consists of a [[purple shirt|purple]] [[sailor shirt|sailor blouse]] with white accents and [[puffy short sleeves]], a [[purple bowtie]] held with a [[horseshoe ornament]], a [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[white skirt]] with a [[large bow|large]] [[back bow]], and [[white thighhighs]] or [[over-kneehighs]]; as well as [[brown shoes|brown]] [[loafers]] with medium heels.

The [[winter uniform]] has mostly the same design, but the blouse having [[long sleeves]] with dark purple highlights. Meanwhile, the bowtie is now [[white bowtie|white]], the skirt is [[purple skirt|purple]] instead of white, and the [[purple thighhighs|knee socks are purple]] with a white line decoration.

Additionally, the uniform includes short black [[bike shorts]] worn [[bike_shorts_under_skirt|under the skirt]]

h4. Examples

* !post #3076018: [[Summer uniform]]
* !post #7360132: [[Winter uniform]]

h4. See also

* [[List of uniforms]]

title: rapi_(nikke)
body:
A character in [[Goddess of Victory: Nikke]]. 

A member of the [[Counters (nikke)|]] squad along with [[anis (nikke)|Anis]] and [[neon (nikke)|Neon]], Rapi is usually protective, obedient, and an expressionless Nikke. 

She has [[orange eyes]], [[large breasts]] and [[long hair|long]] [[brown hair]]. She wears a [[black headwear|black]] [[beret]], [[black jacket|black]] [[cropped jacket]], [[black leotard|black]] [[collared leotard]], [[red necktie]], [[black gloves|black]] and [[red gloves|red]] [[two-tone gloves]], [[black thighhighs]], [[black footwear]], and a [[black choker]]. Usually depicted [[holding gun|holding]] or having an [[CZ 805 BREN]] [[assault rifle]] [[gun on back|on her back]].

[spoilers]Rapi was once a [[rapi_(mass_produced)_(nikke)|Mass-produced Nikke]] with the serial number RR-15436. At some point in time, Rapi met [[Red Hood (nikke)|]], a former member of the legendary [[Goddess (nikke)|]] squad. When Red Hood died, Rapi somehow assimilated her entire body, more than doubling her mass and giving her a second core, a feat believed to be impossible. This has given her the ability to release immense heat from her body and intensifying her strength.[/spoilers]

[spoilers]Later she was upgraded and became a member of [[Absolute (Nikke)|]], Elysion's most powerful squad consisting (currently) of [[Emma (nikke)|]], [[Eunhwa (nikke)|]], and [[Vesti (nikke)|]]. However during a mission, one of Rapi's explosives killed a human, causing her to have an identity crisis. This led to Rapi leaving Absolute, much to her teammates dismay, and eventually joining the [[Counters (nikke)|]].[/spoilers]

Illustrators: [[Kim Hyung tae|Kim Hyung-tae]] and [[Hyulla]]
Voice actress: [[Ishikawa Yui]](JP)

title: marisa_(street_fighter)
body:
Her full name is [b]Marisa Rosetti[/b]. She is a character from [[Street Fighter]], first debuting in [[Street Fighter 6]]. She is currently [[tall female|the tallest]] and heaviest female fighter in the game, owning to her extremely [[muscular female|muscular]] build.

A [[Greece|Greco]]-[[Italy|Italian]] jewelry designer and pankration wrestler. Despite her intimidating stature and her use of aggresive fighting technique, Marisa is an upbeat and well-mannered fighter who seeks thrill of combat and living her life to its fullest.

She is notable for being the first [[bisexual female|bisexual]] and polyamourous character of the Street Fighter franchise, proclaiming that she "has enough love for everyone".

h5. Official Bio

An up-and-coming jewelry designer from Italy who claims ancestry to ancient Greek warriors. As a child, she was inspired by a vision of the Colosseum in its prime. Today, she seeks glory with a smile—and an eye for beauty.

* [b]Hates:[/b] Heights
* [b]Likes:[/b] Worthy opponents, ossobuco, fine arts
* [b]Height:[/b] 203cm / 6'8"
* [b]Weight:[/b] 122kg / 269 lbs
other_names: マリーザ(ストリートファイター)

title: mishima_kazuya
body:
[[Tekken]] character. Intially introduced as the series' protagonist before turned into secondary antagonist/anti-hero in the later installments.

Years before the first Tekken tournament, Kazuya's father [[Mishima Heihachi|Heihachi]] took over the title of Mishima Zaibatsu CEO from his father [[Mishima Jinpachi|Jinpachi]] and tried to toss Kazuya from atop a ravine in an attempt to avoid repeating his father's fate.

Heihachi hosted the first Tekken tournament to see if any fighter is worthy enough to beat him. But it seems that no one is able to meet the criteria until Kazuya, whom he threw atop a ravine years ago, meets him. In an ironic self-fulfilling prophecy, Kazuya eventually defeats Heihachi and tosses him onto the same ravine that Heihachi used to throw Kazuya, making him the new CEO of the Mishima Zaibatsu. He would lose this position to his father once more, with him instead opting to take over G Corporation. He later married [[Kazama Jun]], and the two would later have a son named [[Kazama Jin|]].

In the subsequent installments, Kazuya began to slowly corrupts into an evil persona as a result of his [[Devil (tekken)|demonic]] gene from his [[Mishima Kazumi (tekken)|late mother]]. As a result, his son Jin turned against him and challenged Kazuya for the title of CEO of the Mishima Zaibatsu, their battle ultimately culminating with [[Tekken 8|the eighth Tekken tournament]].

h4. See also

* [[Electric Wind God Fist]]
